intro: Roldana guadalajarensis, commonly known as the Guadalajara roldana, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Jalisco, Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments with cool temperatures. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
